persName.desc: You can either create child elements for every component like ism, kunya, etc. into the Additional Name OR you enter the full form into the Fullname field.

addName.desc: Name elements like kunya or patronym that do not fit the mold of forenames and surnames. Choose the type of name from the attribute list.

name.desc: The full form of a person's name.

birth.desc: Provide the date and place of birth in the respective child elements.

date.desc: Fill in the date in the agreed-upon calendrical system. Use the "when" attribute for precise values. In case the date can only be approximated, use the "notAfter "and "notBefore" attributes together.

valItem.desc: Hebrew calendar
Era of Alexander of Macedon, year 1 = 319 BC
Islamic Era
Julian calendar

attDef.desc: indicates the length of this element in time.
시간선상에서 이 요소의 길이를 나타낸다.
指明此元素的時間長度。
時間幅を示す．
indique la longueur de cet élément dans le temps
indica la durata nel tempo di tale elemento
indica la longitud de este elemento en el tiempo.
indicates the length of this element in time.
시간에서 이 요소의 길이를 나타낸다.
指出此元素的時間長度。
当該時間の長さを示す．
indique la longueur de cet élément dans le temps
indica la durata nel tempo dell'elemento
indica la longitud de este elemento en el tiempo.

valItem.desc: Age, the value should be given in a @dur attribute according to W3C datatypes
Duration of a reign, the value should be given in a @dur attribute according to W3C datatypes
Duration of life, the value should be given in a @dur attribute according to W3C datatypes
Duration of marriage, the value should be given in a @dur attribute according to W3C datatypes
Generic duration, the value should be given in a @dur attribute according to W3C datatypes
Date of foundation
Date of the composition of a work
Date of the translation of a work
Date of the revision of a work
Date of the composition of a specific recension
Date of a saint’s martyrdom
Date of birth (do not use this in a person record, use element birth)
Date of a person’s ascension to power
Date of death
The date of production of the document (EMA)
If the commemoration is repeated, please add this value as well in type

placeName.desc: Look up the place records in the database to specify a settlement or town. Try different spellings in different languages! If no suitable record exists, create a new one. (The "ref" attribute will be filled out automatically when you link a place record to this element.)

death.desc: Provide the date and place of death in the respective child elements.

date.desc: Fill in the date in the agreed-upon calendrical system. Use the "when" attribute for precise values. In case the date can only be approximated, use the "notAfter "and "notBefore" attributes together.

valItem.desc: Hebrew calendar

Julian calendar

placeName.desc: Look up the place records in the database to specify a settlement or town. Try different spellings in different languages! If no suitable record exists, create a new one. (The "ref" attribute will be filled out automatically when you link a place record to this element.)

floruit.desc: Specify the period of intellectual activity. Fill in the date in the agreed-upon calendrical system. Use the "when" attribute for precise values. In case the date can only be approximated, use the "notAfter "and "notBefore" attributes together.

faith.desc: Specify the denomination of the person.

occupation.desc: Describe the person's profession. This is NOT the role the person played with regard to the manuscripts.

placeName.desc: Look up the place records in the database to specify a settlement or town. Try different spellings in different languages! If no suitable record exists, create a new one. (The "ref" attribute will be filled out automatically when you link a place record to this element.)

bibl.desc: A bibliographic item, like a monograph, journal article, or manuscript.

valItem.desc: The reference is to a manuscript
The reference is to the Bodleian Quarto Catalogues
The reference is to the Bodleian Summary Catalogue
The reference is to the Bodleian Old Catalogue
The reference is to the bible
The reference is to a commentary
The reference is to an edition
The reference is to an extract
The reference is to a related item
The reference is to a textually-related item
The reference is to a translation

title.desc: contains a title for any kind of work.

citedRange.desc: defines the range of cited content, often represented by pages or other units

valItem.desc: page
chapter
column
issue
line
part
volume
item number
folio
numbered note (footnote, sidenote, endnote)

idno.desc: supplies any form of identifier used to identify some object, such as a bibliographic item, a person, a title, an organization, etc. in a standardized way.

attDef.desc: categorizes the identifier, for example as an ISBN, Social Security number, etc.
classe un numéro dans une catégorie, par exemple comme étant un numéro ISBN ou comme appartenant une autre série normalisée.
예를 들어 ISBN 또는 기타 표준 일련번호로, 숫자를 범주화한다.
表明編碼的種類，例如國際標準書號 (ISBN) 或其他標準系列編碼。
当該数値の分類を示す．例えば，ISBNなど．
bestimmt die Art des Identifikators (z. B. ISBN, Sozialversicherungsnummer, URI)
clasifica el número, por ejemplo como un ISBN o cualquier otro número estándard.
classifica l'identificatore, ad esempio come codice ISBN o altri generi di identificatori standard.

valItem.desc: International Standard Book Number: a 13- or (if assigned prior to 2007) 10-digit identifying number assigned by the publishing industry to a published book or similar item, registered with the International ISBN Agency.
International Standard Serial Number: an eight-digit number to uniquely identify a serial publication.
Digital Object Identifier: a unique string of letters and numbers assigned to an electronic document.
Uniform Resource Identifier: a string of characters to uniquely identify a resource which usually contains indication of the means of accessing that resource, the name of its host, and its filepath.
A data number in the Virtual Internet Authority File assigned to link different names in catalogs around the world for the same entity.
English Short-Title Catalogue number: an identifying number assigned to a document in English printed in the British Isles or North America before 1801.
OCLC control number (record number) for the union catalog record in WorldCat, a union catalog for member libraries in the Online Computer Library Center global cooperative.
